placeDesc: Down in the empty brick arcades of the Grand Central Building basement is the Ars Obscure Bookbinding and Restoration Company. Inside the small shop, the centuries-old profession of bookbinding is alive and well.The operation is festooned with hanging leathers, excitingly chunky metal presses, and a host of other equipment that hail from a distant time and place outside the quotidian and modern. If you’re lucky, the quiet owner may be in and working. A small selection of notebooks and other handbound items are for sale, but the shop also specializes in restoring and binding historical works and grimoires. Also, there is almost always a bouquet of free, magnificently marbled paper bookmarkers for visitors.
placeShortDesc: In this subterranean brick arcade, a small shop continues the ancient practice of bookbinding.
placeNearby: Seattle Underground,Smith Tower Penthouse,The Arctic Club
placeRelatedPlaces: The Ancient Books of Wales,For Keeps Bookstore,Coal Creek Library,Suzzallo Library Reading Room
